DOC.brief_summary: The overall goal develop new clinical approach restore upper-limb function incomplete cervical spinal cord injury ( SCI ) . Corticospinal tract ( CST ) axon involve control upper-limb function . Paired pulse induce spike-timing dependent plasticity ( STDP ) enhance synaptic strength residual CST axon spinal motoneuron ( SMNs ) result temporary improvement upper-limb function human incomplete cervical SCI . Motor training combine paired-pulse STDP stimulation enhance plasticity behavioral recovery .
DOC.brief_title: Enhancing STDP After Spinal Cord Injury
DOC.criteria: Participants unimpaired healthy control : Male female age 1885 year Right hand Able complete precision grip hand Able complete full wrist flexionextension bilaterally Able walk unassisted Able complete full ankle flexionextension bilaterally Participants spinal cord injury : Male female age 1885 year SCI ( 2 month injury ) Spinal Cord injury L5 The ability produce visible precision grip force one hand Able perform small wrist flexion extension The ability perform small visible contraction dorsiflexion hip flexor muscle No subject exclude base race , religion , ethnicity , gender HIV status . ASIA A , B , C , D Exclusion criterion enrollment For SCI Healthy Control Subjects ( 48 exclusion noninvasive brain stimulation ) : Uncontrolled medical problem include pulmonary , cardiovascular orthopedic disease Any debilitating disease prior SCI cause exercise intolerance Premorbid , ongoing major depression psychosis , alter cognitive status History head injury stroke Metal plate skull History seizures Receiving drug act primarily central nervous system , low seizure threshold ( see appendix 2 ) Pregnant females Ongoing cord compression syrinx spinal cord suffer spinal cord disease spinal stenosis , spina bifida , MS , herniated disk Individuals scalp shrapnel , cochlear implant , aneurysm clip .
